channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SCoralDet: Efficient real-time underwater soft coral detection with YOLO
item.description: To address these challenges, we propose SCoralDet, a soft coral detection model based on the YOLO architecture.

item.title: Robust Portfolio Optimization using GOPALS: Geospatial Optimization and Portfolio Allocation using Landscape Segmentation
item.description: This study introduces GOPALS: Geospatial Optimization and Portfolio Allocation using Landscape Segmentation, a simulation-based portfolio optimization framework designed to overcome these limitations and improve the robustness of the portfolio optimization process.

item.title: DeepSeek-VL2: Mixture-of-Experts Vision-Language Models for Advanced Multimodal Understanding
item.description: We present DeepSeek-VL2, an advanced series of large Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) Vision-Language Models that significantly improves upon its predecessor, DeepSeek-VL, through two key major upgrades.

item.title: Large Action Models: From Inception to Implementation
item.description: As AI continues to advance, there is a growing demand for systems that go beyond language-based assistance and move toward intelligent agents capable of performing real-world actions.

item.title: Real-time Identity Defenses against Malicious Personalization of Diffusion Models
item.description: Personalized diffusion models, capable of synthesizing highly realistic images based on a few reference portraits, pose substantial social, ethical, and legal risks by enabling identity replication.

item.title: Does Multiple Choice Have a Future in the Age of Generative AI? A Posttest-only RCT
item.description: Using a posttest-only randomized control design, we compare the performance of 234 tutors (790 lesson completions) across three conditions: MCQ only, open response only, and a combination of both.

item.title: AutoPatent: A Multi-Agent Framework for Automatic Patent Generation
item.description: As the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) continue to advance, the field of patent processing has garnered increased attention within the natural language processing community.

item.title: Semi-IIN: Semi-supervised Intra-inter modal Interaction Learning Network for Multimodal Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Despite multimodal sentiment analysis being a fertile research ground that merits further investigation, current approaches take up high annotation cost and suffer from label ambiguity, non-amicable to high-quality labeled data acquisition.

item.title: CaLoRAify: Calorie Estimation with Visual-Text Pairing and LoRA-Driven Visual Language Models
item.description: The obesity phenomenon, known as the heavy issue, is a leading cause of preventable chronic diseases worldwide.

item.title: Data Integration with Fusion Searchlight: Classifying Brain States from Resting-state fMRI
item.description: In our study, we present a fusion searchlight (FuSL) framework to combine the complementary information contained in different resting-state fMRI metrics and demonstrate how this can improve the decoding of brain states.

item.title: FM2S: Self-Supervised Fluorescence Microscopy Denoising With Single Noisy Image
item.description: Fluorescence microscopy has significantly advanced biological research by visualizing detailed cellular structures and biological processes.

item.title: Semi-Periodic Activation for Time Series Classification
item.description: This paper investigates the lack of research on activation functions for neural network models in time series tasks.

item.title: UniMed-CLIP: Towards a Unified Image-Text Pretraining Paradigm for Diverse Medical Imaging Modalities
item.description: UniMed is developed using a data-collection framework that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) to transform modality-specific classification datasets into image-text formats while incorporating existing image-text data from the medical domain, facilitating scalable VLM pretraining.

item.title: Byte Latent Transformer: Patches Scale Better Than Tokens
item.description: We introduce the Byte Latent Transformer (BLT), a new byte-level LLM architecture that, for the first time, matches tokenization-based LLM performance at scale with significant improvements in inference efficiency and robustness.

item.title: RETQA: A Large-Scale Open-Domain Tabular Question Answering Dataset for Real Estate Sector
item.description: To tackle these challenges, we propose the SLUTQA framework, which integrates large language models with spoken language understanding tasks to enhance retrieval and answering accuracy.

item.title: Sims: An Interactive Tool for Geospatial Matching and Clustering
item.description: Acquiring, processing, and visualizing geospatial data requires significant computing resources, especially for large spatio-temporal domains.

item.title: ROUTE: Robust Multitask Tuning and Collaboration for Text-to-SQL
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose a novel RObust mUltitask Tuning and collaboration mEthod (ROUTE) to improve the comprehensive capabilities of open-source LLMs for Text2SQL, thereby providing a more practical solution.

item.title: Building a Multi-modal Spatiotemporal Expert for Zero-shot Action Recognition with CLIP
item.description: Zero-shot action recognition (ZSAR) requires collaborative multi-modal spatiotemporal understanding.

item.title: Prompt2Perturb (P2P): Text-Guided Diffusion-Based Adversarial Attacks on Breast Ultrasound Images
item.description: In contrast, diffusion-based attacks require pre-trained models, demanding substantial data when these models are unavailable, limiting practical use in data-scarce scenarios.

item.title: GraSP: Simple yet Effective Graph Similarity Predictions
item.description: In GSC, graph edit distance (GED) and maximum common subgraph (MCS) are two important similarity metrics, both of which are NP-hard to compute.

item.title: Data Pruning Can Do More: A Comprehensive Data Pruning Approach for Object Re-identification
item.description: Previous studies have demonstrated that not each sample in a dataset is of equal importance during training.

item.title: Enhancing the Reasoning Capabilities of Small Language Models via Solution Guidance Fine-Tuning
item.description: To overcome these limitations, this paper introduce a new reasoning strategy Solution Guidance (SG) and a plug-and-play training paradigm Solution-Guidance Fine-Tuning (SGFT) for enhancing the reasoning capabilities of small language models.

item.title: GaussianAD: Gaussian-Centric End-to-End Autonomous Driving
item.description: We initialize the scene with uniform 3D Gaussians and use surrounding-view images to progressively refine them to obtain the 3D Gaussian scene representation.

item.title: Simple Guidance Mechanisms for Discrete Diffusion Models
item.description: Diffusion models for continuous data gained widespread adoption owing to their high quality generation and control mechanisms.

item.title: Benchmarking Linguistic Diversity of Large Language Models
item.description: The development and evaluation of Large Language Models (LLMs) has primarily focused on their task-solving capabilities, with recent models even surpassing human performance in some areas.

item.title: Multi-Head Encoding for Extreme Label Classification
item.description: During the training process, MHE decomposes extreme labels into the product of multiple short local labels, with each head trained on these local labels.

item.title: Learning Visually Grounded Domain Ontologies via Embodied Conversation and Explanation
item.description: In this paper, we offer a learning framework in which the agent's knowledge gaps are overcome through corrective feedback from a teacher whenever the agent explains its (incorrect) predictions.

item.title: Can LLMs Convert Graphs to Text-Attributed Graphs?
item.description: To address this, recent approaches introduce text-attributed graphs, where each node is associated with a textual description, enabling the use of a shared textual encoder to project nodes from different graphs into a unified feature space.

item.title: One Node One Model: Featuring the Missing-Half for Graph Clustering
item.description: Most existing graph clustering methods primarily focus on exploiting topological structure, often neglecting the ``missing-half" node feature information, especially how these features can enhance clustering performance.

item.title: GaussianWorld: Gaussian World Model for Streaming 3D Occupancy Prediction
item.description: 3D occupancy prediction is important for autonomous driving due to its comprehensive perception of the surroundings.

item.title: MST-R: Multi-Stage Tuning for Retrieval Systems and Metric Evaluation
item.description: Regulatory documents are rich in nuanced terminology and specialized semantics.

item.title: Enhancing Multimodal Large Language Models Complex Reason via Similarity Computation
item.description: Multimodal large language models have experienced rapid growth, and numerous different models have emerged.

item.title: Unsupervised Named Entity Disambiguation for Low Resource Domains
item.description: In the ever-evolving landscape of natural language processing and information retrieval, the need for robust and domain-specific entity linking algorithms has become increasingly apparent.

item.title: RemDet: Rethinking Efficient Model Design for UAV Object Detection
item.description: Our contributions are as follows: 1) Rethinking the challenges of existing detectors for small and dense UAV images, and proposing information loss as a design guideline for efficient models.

item.title: Langevin Monte Carlo Beyond Lipschitz Gradient Continuity
item.description: We present a significant advancement in the field of Langevin Monte Carlo (LMC) methods by introducing the Inexact Proximal Langevin Algorithm (IPLA).

item.title: Reversing the Damage: A QP-Aware Transformer-Diffusion Approach for 8K Video Restoration under Codec Compression
item.description: In this paper, we introduce DiQP; a novel Transformer-Diffusion model for restoring 8K video quality degraded by codec compression.

item.title: Structural Entropy Guided Probabilistic Coding
item.description: Probabilistic embeddings have several advantages over deterministic embeddings as they map each data point to a distribution, which better describes the uncertainty and complexity of data.

item.title: Multimodal Music Generation with Explicit Bridges and Retrieval Augmentation
item.description: Multimodal music generation aims to produce music from diverse input modalities, including text, videos, and images.

item.title: Auto-Regressive Moving Diffusion Models for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: This design aligns the diffusion model's sampling procedure with the forecasting objective, resulting in an unconditional, continuous sequential diffusion TSF model.

item.title: A Flexible Plug-and-Play Module for Generating Variable-Length
item.description: The NHL framework introduces a novel mechanism to simultaneously generate hash codes of varying lengths in a nested manner.

item.title: V2PE: Improving Multimodal Long-Context Capability of Vision-Language Models with Variable Visual Position Encoding
item.description: In our work, we first conduct an empirical analysis of the long-context capabilities of VLMs using our augmented long-context multimodal datasets.

item.title: USDRL: Unified Skeleton-Based Dense Representation Learning with Multi-Grained Feature Decorrelation
item.description: Additionally, we design a Dense Spatio-Temporal Encoder (DSTE) to capture fine-grained action representations effectively, thereby enhancing the performance of dense prediction tasks.

item.title: LatentSync: Audio Conditioned Latent Diffusion Models for Lip Sync
item.description: Since we did not change the overall training framework of SyncNet, our experience can also be applied to other lip sync and audio-driven portrait animation methods that utilize SyncNet.

item.title: Temporal Action Localization with Cross Layer Task Decoupling and Refinement
item.description: Temporal action localization (TAL) involves dual tasks to classify and localize actions within untrimmed videos.

item.title: MaskTerial: A Foundation Model for Automated 2D Material Flake Detection
item.description: The detection and classification of exfoliated two-dimensional (2D) material flakes from optical microscope images can be automated using computer vision algorithms.

item.title: Motif Guided Graph Transformer with Combinatorial Skeleton Prototype Learning for Skeleton-Based Person Re-Identification
item.description: This paper presents a generic Motif guided graph transformer with Combinatorial skeleton prototype learning (MoCos) that exploits structure-specific and gait-related body relations as well as combinatorial features of skeleton graphs to learn effective skeleton representations for person re-ID.

item.title: Owl-1: Omni World Model for Consistent Long Video Generation
item.description: As videos are observations of the underlying evolving world, we propose to model the long-term developments in a latent space and use VGMs to film them into videos.

item.title: Diffusion Predictive Control with Constraints
item.description: Diffusion models have recently gained popularity for policy learning in robotics due to their ability to capture high-dimensional and multimodal distributions.

item.title: Federated Foundation Models on Heterogeneous Time Series
item.description: Training a general-purpose time series foundation models with robust generalization capabilities across diverse applications from scratch is still an open challenge.

item.title: Filter-then-Generate: Large Language Models with Structure-Text Adapter for Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: Fundamentally, applying LLMs on KGC introduces several critical challenges, including a vast set of entity candidates, hallucination issue of LLMs, and under-exploitation of the graph structure.
